WorkItem.ClosedComment: I'll have to take this up with Web Essentials - TypeScript (prior to version 0.8.2.0) doesn't do *anything* on Save, so whatever weirdness WE is adding is the problem here. There isn't anything on our end we can do.
WorkItem.Description:
I know this has been reported in other forums, but I've never seen a resolution.  In a project with TS objects under source control, a TS script with references will not compile on save unless those referenced scripts are also checked out.  In a project with multiple developers, this causes lots of problems.  I have seen a suggested solution that says to turn off the web essentials "Compile TypeScript on save" option and turn on the "Compile all TypeScript files on build" option, but that setting checks out every typescript object when it builds.  Again, in a multi-user project, this is not feasible.

Since the error is occurring in tsc.js, is that something that has or will be corrected in the .8.2 release?  Is there a usable workaround?


    /*
    
    Compile Error. 
    See error list for details
     tsc.js(23862, 29) Microsoft JScript runtime error: Write to file failed.
    
    */

Comments.Message: Can you upload a repro project or give more details? We've only gotten anecdotal reports here and haven't been able to reproduce the problem

I've attached a sample project (in parts).  The error can be reproduced by making a change and attempting to save \Scripts\app\ViewModels\locationViewModel.ts.

I'm assuming that you'd need to register the solution in source control first to replicate the error.

I'm using VS2012 Premium, with all the updates applied, Web Essentials 2.3, TypeScript 0.8.1.1, VSTS 2010
